Dear FOI Officer,
I am writing to request information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. In order to assist you with this request, I am outlining my query as specifically as possible.
1.A - How many vacant council homes, including void properties do you currently have to date? (6th April 2024).
1.B - How many of these properties have been vacant for longer than 3 months?
1.C - How many of these properties have been vacant for longer than 6 months?
1.D - How many of these properties have been vacant for longer than 1 year?
2.A How many people do you currently have to date on your current council housing waiting list? (6th March 2024)
2.B How many homeless families and or individuals have you received from London boroughs (out of area rehousing) in the last 5 years (2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023)
- Additionally how many homeless families and or individuals have you received from London boroughs (out of area rehousing) since the beginning of 2024 (Jan 2024, Feb, 2024, March, 2024)
2.C How many people that declared themselves homeless to your council in the last year, were not deemed a priority need and therefore were not accepted onto your council housing waiting list?
I would be grateful if you could confirm in writing that you have received this request. I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as outlined by the statute.
Yours faithfully,
Kwajo Tweneboa

Dear Kwajo Tweneboa,
Thank you for your request for information relating to void/empty
properties and homeless figures which we received on 06/04/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request below:
1.A - How many vacant council homes, including void properties do you
currently have to date? (6th April 2024).
As at w/c 8/4/24 there are 946 properties in total.
1.B - How many of these properties have been vacant for longer than 3
months?
443 have been void for 90 days+.
1.C - How many of these properties have been vacant for longer than 6
months?
277 have been void 180 days+.
1.D - How many of these properties have been vacant for longer than 1
year?
204 have been void for over 365 days.
2.A How many people do you currently have to date on your current council
housing waiting list? (6th March 2024)
As of 10^th April 2024, there are 24,522 households registered with an
active application on the housing register. Sheffield City Council does
not have a waiting list, customers apply and accrue time from the date
their application is accepted. Customers show an interest by placing bids
on available properties as and when they choose.
Customers do not need to have an immediate housing need to join the
housing register; they may be assessed for priority award at any time, the
outcome of the assessment does not impact their right to access the
register.
To join and remain on the housing register, customers must be eligible and
qualify. Further information on qualification can be read in Sheffield
City Council’s Allocations Policy, section 3. The Allocations Policy can
be found at the following link: [1]Housing Policy Allocation
(sheffieldpropertyshop.org.uk)
2.B How many homeless families and or individuals have you received from
London boroughs (out of area rehousing) in the last 5 years (2019, 2020,
2021, 2022, 2023)
- Additionally how many homeless families and or individuals have you
received from London boroughs (out of area rehousing) since the beginning
of 2024 (Jan 2024, Feb, 2024, March, 2024)
Sheffield City Council do not hold this information.
2.C How many people that declared themselves homeless to your council in
the last year, were not deemed a priority need and therefore were not
accepted onto your council housing waiting list?
Please see our nationally published data at the following link:
[2]
https://www.gov.uk/government/statistica...
As this is information, which is accessible to the applicant by other
means, it is exempt from disclosure under section 21 of the Freedom of
Information Act 2000.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [3]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[4]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
